title: Install the suite using AppHub
content:
To install an application using OMT AppHub UI, you need to first upload the helm chart to AppHub. 

To use AppHub, you must already have OMT installed.

Upload the application chart using AppHub

To do this, follow these steps.

Log in to AppHub

  1. Copy the installation portal URL to a supported browser. The URL uses the following format: https://<external_access_host>:<apphub-port>/apphub.
    For example: https://myhost.mycompany.com:5443/apphub
  2. Log in using the cluster administrator credentials that you provided when you ran the OMT ./install command:
    • User name: admin
    • Password: Enter the password you provided during OMT installation.
  3. Click LOG IN.

Upload a Helm chart

You can only upload one application (two files) at a time. Otherwise, you'll get a warning and the upload will fail.
If you try uploading a chart file without a provenance file, you will get a warning that this isn't recommended. Because AppHub won't be able to verify the integrity of the chart. It's recommended always uploading the chart with its provenance file.

  1. On the APPLICATIONS page, click the Upload an Application icon    . An Upload an Application page appears. 
  2. Follow the screen prompt to upload an application's Helm chart (*.tgz) and an application's provenance file (*.tgz.prov) and then click Upload.
  3. Wait a few seconds until you see Application Upload Complete. Click Upload Another if you need to upload another Helm chart or click Exit. 
  4. Refresh on the APPLICATIONS page and the uploaded application will appear on the page.

After you have uploaded ESM Helm chart to the repository, the associated application tile will appear on the Applications page. 

To configure an application, complete the following steps:

  1. Click on an application tile, select a release version, and then click Configure. Or, click the configure icon   or select a Release version in the drop down list, and then click the configure icon.
    The application details appear on the Deployments page, which displays the parameters defined in the Helm chart.
  2. Configure the application parameters for each category tab that appears in the side menu. Each tab contains a series of fields and controls that enable you to configure the parameters that exist in the application’s Helm chart. When you are configuring an application, note the following:
    A tab with an   icon indicates that one or more parameters are incomplete or invalid.
    A tab with a check mark   indicates that all parameters are complete and valid.
    View help by hovering over parameter names.
    A toggle  represents a Boolean parameter that may show or hide additional parameters.
    Some parameters are immutable (or read-only) after successful deployment. These parameters are immutable because editing them could cause configuration issues.

    The side menu contains the following category tabs. Note that if there is nothing to configure for a category, the corresponding tab isn't displayed.
    General: Configure external access parameters, including host names, ports, and Docker register settings.
    Capabilities: Configure EMS capabilities.
    Security: Configure the administrator password, override options for the user ID (UID) and group ID (GID), and upload trusted CA certificates.
    Databases: Configure database options and verify that the database connection information is valid. OPTIC AppHub displays the validation response sent by the database.

  3. After you review each tab and configure all the required parameters:
    Click Deploy at the bottom of the page to deploy the application directly to Kubernetes
    Click the Export icon at the top of the page to create a .zip file and deploy it via Helm CLI
    Click the Save icon at the top of the page to finish configuring the deployment at a later time. 

YAML EDITOR

The YAML EDITOR enables you to configure additional parameters that aren't exposed in AppHub UI, but are available in the application Helm chart.

Sample yaml file is provided in the Helm download package. This sample file can be found under the ESM_Helm_Chart-2x.x.x/samples folder and it contains sample configurations and parameter definitions. Refer to this sample file as a guide to configure additional parameters with the yaml editor.

To configure parameters not available in the AppHub, use the following steps:

  1. Click YAML EDITOR.
  2. Search the sample yaml file for the parameters you wish to configure. You need to configure all the required storage class parameters.
  3. Copy the parameter from the sample yaml to the YAML editor.
  4. Add all the configuration updates that apply to your deployment. These updates vary based on the capabilities, configurations, and integrations enabled in your environment. Review the following conditions and include only the relevant updates.
    1. If the Aviator capability is enabled in your Suite deployment and has a cross-domain integration with products such as AI Operations Management (AIOM) or Universal Discovery and CMDB  (UD/UCMDB), apply the following update: 
      bo:
  configmap:
    bo:
      SMAX_AUTH_TOKEN_SAMESITE: "None"
    2. If the UID or GID is not the default value (1999) but larger than six digits, apply the following update: 
      global:
  securityContext:
    fsGroup: <GID>
    user: <UID>
    3. If your deployment is on AKS, apply the following update related to nginx annotation parameter. 
      global:
  nginx:
    annotationPrefix: "nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io"
  5. Add any additional customization needed for your deployment.
  6. Click SAVE.

It's recommended to use the AppHub UI for all configurations unless otherwise absolutely necessary.

Configure General Settings

External Access Settings

Configuration parameter in UI Description Default setting

External Access Host Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN)

Enter the Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) of the external access host, which you provided during the OMT installation. Use this host to access SMA.

External Access Port

Use this port to access all EMS services.

Make sure to configure different port numbers on each instance of ESM if you are deploying multiple instances of ESM on the same Kubernetes cluster.

Make sure to configure a different port number than the port number of the external host that you entered in the config.json file used when installing OMT.

You can't change the port number after the initial deployment.  

443

VERIFY AVAILABLE

Enter the port number of the ESM external access host and click VERIFY AVAILABLE. If the port is available, you'll see the Available message. If the port is in use, you'll see the Port is not available message. Enter another port number and try again.

Currently, 443 is the only external access port supported for the suite installation.

Docker Registry Settings

The Docker Settings are already populated with the default Registry and Organization name. It's recommended to use the same organization name and Docker registry that you used during OMT installation.

If you have configured the deployment with a different registry, enter the following details:

Configuration parameter Description Default setting

Docker Registry Name

Enter the URL containing the repository hostname and the port number of your docker registry.

For AWS, enter the URL containing the ECR repository hostname. For example:
788232947507.dkr.ecr.us-west-1.amazonaws.com

localhost:5000

Docker Organization Name

Enter the organization name of the Docker repository.

hpeswitom

Deployment size

Configuration parameter Description Default setting
Expected Deployment Size

Select the deployment size. You can choose one of the following: 
Small, containerized deployment (up to 400 concurrent users)
Medium, containerized deployment (up to 1000 concurrent users)
Large, containerized deployment (up to 3000 concurrent users)

 Small, containerized deployment (up to 400 concurrent users)

Time Zone

Define the time zone for SMA logs based on your location (default: UTC) *

Configuration parameter Description Default setting
Choose the desired Time Zone from the list below

Select  the time zone for SMA logs based on your location:

UTC

 UTC

Kubernetes Provider

You can't change the Kubernetes provider after you deploy ESM. Select Kubernetes Provider:

Configuration parameter Description Default setting
Kubernetes Provider

Select one of the following Kubernetes: 
Embedded Kubernetes from the OPTIC Management Toolkit
Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service
Microsoft Azure Kubernetes Service
Google Cloud Platform GKE
   If selected, you should enter Loadbalance IP
RedHat OpenShift Bring your own Kubernetes.

 Embedded Kubernetes from the OPTIC Management Toolkit

Configure Capabilities

The process management capabilities - IT Service Management and Asset Management will be installed as a part of the foundation fo a new deployment.

The following capabilities are available for installation through the AppHub UI. You can choose to install them now or at any later time, however, the Service Management Automation (SMA) is mandatory for all new installations.

Capability Description Notes
Service Management (Suite) Underlying services of the Service Management.

Mandatory for all new installations.

This capability is automatically installed and does not require further installation tasks.
Service Portal for Service Manager (SMPS)  Services required to integrate an external Service Manager system with the Service Portal.
  • Mandatory for SMA-SM customers
  • Optional for Service Management customers who want to additionally deploy one or more Service Manager tenants
  • Not applicable to Cloud Management or Asset Management customers
Cloud Management

The Cloud Management capability enables customers to make new cloud service offerings based on published service designs available to consumers. 

Before you enable and use  the Design and Deploy functionality, you must install and enable Operations Orchestration(OO) Containerized capability. For more information, see Install OO on-premises and Enable OO Containerized in Suite Administration.
  • Mandatory for Cloud Management customers
  • Optional for Service Management customers
  • Not applicable to SMA-SM or Asset Management customers
Cloud Cost Reporting Cloud Cost Reporting enables you to optimize your cloud spending and simplify configuration with various Cloud providers. You can review your public cloud costs to get a clearer understanding of your activity and usage of public cloud resources.
  • Optional for Service Management and Cloud Management customers
  • Not applicable to SMA-SM or Asset Management customers
Cloud Carbon Footprint 

Carbon aims to provide insights into your IT estate, enabling you to identify under or over consumption and optimize capacity. To use the Cloud Carbon Footprint functionality, you must first enable Cloud Cost Reporting capability.
Software Asset Management (SAM) With the hardware and software data discovered by UD and license data retrieved from Service Management, the new SAM capability enables you to calculate and analyze license compliance for the software applications that you are using in your organization. This will reduce the risk of non compliance and improve the visibility into your financial and operational decisions.
  • Optional for Service Management and Asset Management customers
  • Not applicable to SMA-SM or Cloud Management customers

Configure external load balancer

If you are using an external load balancer from a cloud provider platform such as GCP or Azure, you must configure the following load balancer parameters. Use the YAML editor to add the parameters.

Cloud provider platform Load balancer settings
GCP Load balancer settings for GCP
Azure Load balancer settings for Azure

Configure Database

External Database Settings

You can deploy the external PostgreSQL database in a single node configuration.

Configuration parameter Description

External PostgreSQL

External PostgreSQL is the only supported database type. 

Configure these parameters:

Database Hostname: Enter the FQDN of the external PostgreSQL database server.

Database Port for External Database: Enter the port number of the external PostgreSQL database server. Default port is 5432.

Database TLS: Use this toggle to enable secure communication with database services. It's enabled by default. When you disable Database TLS, select the checkbox below to acknowledge that you are aware of the associated security risks. It's recommended to enable TLS.

Select the ssl mode: 

  • verify-ca I want my data encrypted, and I accept the overhead. I want to be sure that I connect to a server that I trust.
  • verify-full I want my data encrypted, and I accept the overhead. I want to be sure that I connect to a server I trust, and that it's the one I specify.

Upload CA or self-signed certificates for TLS. Required for communication with components like Vertica, Postgres, etc.

Configure PostgreSQL Database

Configuration parameter Description Default value
Automatically create required databases

Enable this option to automatically create the required databases.

This option is applicable only for an on-premises deployment.

 Enabled
Database Superuser (Database Administrator) Enter the superuser (administrator) username for the database. postgres
Database Superuser Password Enter the superuser (administrator) password for the database.
VERIFY Click to validate the connection to the database server.

Set Suite Database Owner Password

All passwords must meet the following requirements:

  •  Length must be at least 10 characters
  •  Length cannot exceed 16 characters
  •  Must contain 1 or more upper case characters
  •  Must contain 1 or more lower case characters
  •  Must contain 1 or more digit (0-9) characters
  •  Must contain 1 or more special characters in: -,:/._?&%=+[]()
  •  Cannot contain any extra characters other than: -,:/._?&%=+[]()

Vertica Database

You can deploy the external Vertica database in a single node configuration.

Configuration parameter Description

Vertica

Vertica is the supported vertica database type. 

Configure these parameters:

Vertica Hostname: Enter the FQDN of the Vertica database server.

Port for External Vertica: Enter the port number of the external Vertica database server. The default port is 5433.

Database TLS: Use this toggle to enable secure communication with database services. It's enabled by default. When you disable Database TLS, select the checkbox below to acknowledge that you are aware of the associated security risks. It's recommended to enable TLS.

Select the ssl mode: 

  • verify-ca I want my data encrypted, and I accept the overhead. I want to be sure that I connect to a server that I trust.
  • verify-full I want my data encrypted, and I accept the overhead. I want to be sure that I connect to a server I trust, and that it's the one I specify.

 Upload CA or self-signed certificates for TLS. Required for communication with components like Vertica, Postgres, etc.

Configure Vertica Database

Configuration parameter Description Default value
Vertica Read/Write User Name Vertica admin username with permissions to create tables and other such operations. cgrodba
Vertica Read/Write User Password Enter the Vertica Read/Write User password for the database.
Vertica Database/Schema Name Enter the  Vertica Database/Schema Name. cgrodb
VERIFY Click to validate the connection to the database server.

Configure Security

Suite System Administrator(suite-admin)

Specify an initial password for Suite System Administrator(suite-admin), Suite System Integration User (bo-integration@dummy.com) will be initialized with the same password internally.

All passwords must meet the following requirements:

  •  Length must be at least 10 characters
  •  Length cannot exceed 16 characters
  •  Must contain 1 or more upper case characters
  •  Must contain 1 or more lower case characters
  •  Must contain 1 or more digit (0-9) characters
  •  Must contain 1 or more special characters in: -,:/._?&%=+[]()
  •  Cannot contain any extra characters other than: -,:/._?&%=+[]()

User ID and Group ID

You can't change UID and GID after the initial deployment.

Configuration parameter Description Default setting

User ID (UID)
 

All containers in the deployment will run as this UID.

For RedHat OpenShift deployments, this value is retrieved from the Kubernetes namespace.

 1999

Group ID (GID)
 

All containers in the deployment will run as this GID.

For RedHat OpenShift deployments, this value is retrieved from the Kubernetes namespace.

 1999

Deploy the suite

When you are ready to deploy your application chart, click the Deploy button at the lower right corner of the screen, and then enter the following information. This deploys your application chart directly to Kubernetes. 

  1. Deployment Name: Enter a unique name for this deployment. Pay attention to the naming conventions below. 
  2. Deploy to existing namespace: Enter an existing namespace or select it from the drop-down list.
  3. Create new namespace on deployment: Depending on your installation environment, you can optionally create a new namespace as part of the deployment.  For example, when you enter a name and there are no matching namespaces in the cluster, you can create a new namespace (as long as the namespace name isn't reserved).  If your installation environment prohibits AppHub from creating a new namespace in the cluster, you must select an existing namespace. Pay attention to the naming conventions below when creating a new namespace.
  4. Timeout: Enter a value in minute(s) to wait for Kubernetes commands to complete. The valid value is between 1 and 153722867.
  5. End User License Agreement: Review and accept the End User License Agreement to continue.  
  6. Click OK. AppHub performs a Helm dry run. If the dry run fails, edit the configuration and try again. If the dry run is successful, the deploy process begins and a new deployment tile appears on the Deployments page. On the deployment tile, click the View Details icon to see the deployment Overview and deployment History. The deploy process will also open the deployment health status page, from which you can monitor the deployment status. 

Or, instead of deploying the application immediately, you can also:

  • Click the Export icon to create a .zip file that you can use to deploy the application via the Helm CLI.
  • Click the Save as Draft icon to finish configuring the deployment at a later time. 

(OpenShift only) Edit the namespace

When deploying the suite on OpenShift, you need to edit the namespace created for ESM. For details, see the relevant step in Create a deployment for ESM.
